name: Holiday Inn Express Seattle City Center

reviews.text: We went to Seattle on a last minute trip, and booked this hotel day of for $188 w/BCAA discount....not a bad price.
reviews.title: Good location, good rooms, good price...

reviews.text: We thought the hotel was pretty good:
reviews.title: Great stay

likes.liked: — spacious room and also good value

reviews.text: -nice (if not a bit small) heated indoor pool
reviews.title: Good Business

reviews.text: -free continental breakfast (go early or it's a zoo in there!)
reviews.title: Glad I did stay at Holiday Inn Express Last Night!

reviews.text: -underground parking (a bit tight for SUV's but 'do-able')
reviews.title: Potential Peepers-with little hotel concern

likes.disliked: — Peeping Toms and No Hotel Concern

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 5 nights in the Holiday Inn Express in Seattle in May 2007 and we really enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Good place to stay

reviews.text: The rooms are very spacious and if you´re lucky you get a view on the Space Needle (in walking distance!) for free... :-)
reviews.title: not bad, not great!

reviews.text: The continental breakfast which was included for us was excellent. There were donuts, bagels, fresh fruit, cereals, several juices, cinnamon rolls, coffee, tea, ...
reviews.title: Pretty good for my visit

reviews.text: The hotel has a office room with free internet access, a (small) fitness room and an indoor pool. Unfortunately the office room was closed for several days during our stay.
reviews.title: very happy during our stay

likes.liked: — Value for money, free intenet, free local calls, breakfast, newspaper, location

reviews.title: Incompetent, rude
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights 4 days apart. The first room was great-alot for the money. The second room was kinda gross. The bathtub drain was clogged with hair and there were numerous stains on the carpet. Good views of the space needle in both rooms. Easy walk to the free bus line. Desk service is hit or miss- I advise you call your own taxi. There was a seafair parade in the area with street closures-we called prior to arrival to ask which streets were closed and the front desk had no clue. He advised we try to park on the street somewhere and walk. We made it to the parking lot by taking back streets and asking cops. I like Holiday Inn Express-we had the queen mini suite gov. rate of $124. good deal.
reviews.title: good location

reviews.text: I stayed at this place back in Aug "05" for 3 nights and thought it was great!
reviews.title: Great Base for a tourist!

reviews.text: I had a room on the 3rd floor facing the highway and yes it was a little noisy but fortunately i was still a little jetlagged so i didn't hear it half the time as i slept like a log!
reviews.title: Excellent base for seeing Seattle.

reviews.text: The rooms were quite comfortable and spacious and the Tv had quite a large selection of cable channels.
reviews.title: Notably nice than the Holiday Inn on the same block behind this one

reviews.text: As for the hotel facilities i never used the pool so can't comment on that but i did use the gym and although small it was quite sufficient.
reviews.title: Holiday Inn nothing more nothing less

reviews.text: They had coin operated laundries on site, and in the reception area you present your hotel keycard to reception and they give you free internet access in a little room they have off to the side!
reviews.title: Superb Choice

reviews.text: traveled from TX having one day to see Seattle before moving on to Whidbey Island..Got a bus shuttle to hotel from SeaTac for $12.50 which was a good a tour of downtown, stopping at other hotels. The room was clean the beds extra comfy which was a relief after a long plane ride. Staff was smiling and friendly. Parking was $8 nightly so less than other hotels. Breakfast room was well stocked and nice but we only grabbed juice and coffee before opting to go to Pike Market for breakfast. Interesting that the breakfast room required a room key to enter, extra security is OK with me. Hotel is close to Pike Market. Friendly staff called a yellow cab for us, $5.50 to Pike
reviews.title: clean comfy bed and pillows

reviews.text: Market and no traffic hassles or parking worries. We used those yellow cabs several times and always friendly and proffesional. Once we used an orange cab and were charged 3 bucks more and got a rude driver, he lost his tip, Oh well. I would stay at this location again
reviews.title: OK hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: when visiting. The 2 queen room was pricey in my book but compared to the local hotels was within normal range.
reviews.title: Great Hotel... Great Location...Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was a typical Holiday Inn Express - clean, comfortable rooms - but a little on the small side. The bathroom in our room was tiny and the shower was fitted too low.
reviews.title: Nice hotel...Good Location

reviews.text: Our first room was incredibly noisy because it was by the elevator and the vending machines - the elevator was quiet, but they have the loudest ice machine that filled every 12 minutes. We asked to move room and our next room was fine and quiet.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

aka: Holiday Inn Express Seattle City Hotel Seattle
description: Discover all that Seattle has to offer at the convenient, comfortable Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites. Situated between Seattle Center and the heart of downtown s shopping, dining, and entertainment districts, it's an easy walk to Westlake Center Mall, The Showbox, or Benaroya Hall. The world famous Space Needle and Monorail, Pike Place Market, Seattle Art Museum, Pioneer Square, Pier 66, Cruise Terminal 90/91, Microsoft, Boeing and more are so close our ideal location will suit the needs of any business or leisure traveler. Sports fan? We re minutes to Safeco & CenturyLink Fields! We offer parking for standard sized vehicles at $10 per night (limited space). Whether you re visiting Seattle for work or fun, Holiday Inn Express will be your home away from home. Wake up to our complimentary hot breakfast featuring our signature cinnamon rolls, eggs, bacon or sausage, fresh fruit, and more. Maintain your cardio in our free 24-hour fitness center or go for a swim in our heated, indoor pool. Enjoy a leisurely stroll to numerous restaurants and bars. Our friendly, knowledgeable staff will get you where you need to go! The best of Seattle is waiting for you at the Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites. Book your hotel reservations now for the SeaHawks NFL or Huskies football season or choose from one of our great King Tut Packages. Great family fun is just minutes away!
